intro: Inversodicraea, commonly known as the false mallow, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive leaf morphology, which typically features palmate or lobed shapes. The flowers are usually showy, with five to seven petals arranged in a radial pattern. Inversodicraea species are often found in arid or semi-arid regions, adapting to harsh environmental conditions. These plants are sometimes cultivated for their ornamental value due to their attractive blooms and unique foliage.
